title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: At Partick, the brook Kelvin, which flows through theWest End Park, Glasgow, and will be remembered in the oldsong, " Let us haste to Kelvin Grove, Bonnie Lassie," joinsthe Clyde near the ship building yard of Messrs. Henderson,and at a village, close by Elderslie, is an ancient house calledThe King's Inch, the seat of James Morton, Esq.
